intro: Hexisea bidentata var. imbricata, commonly known as the two-toothed hexisea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-toothed bracts and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
